summary: This is a notice of docket activity from the Second Circuit Court of Appeals regarding case 20-3061, United States v. Maxwell. It records the granting of a motion to seal a document filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's legal team. The notice includes distribution to various attorneys and court personnel.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case United States v. Maxwell, whose legal team filed a motion to seal a document that was granted by the court.

persons.name: T Gee
persons.context: An attorney of record in the case who is listed to receive electronic notice of the court's order.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the case who is listed to receive electronic notice of the court's order.

persons.name: Adam Mueller
persons.context: An Assistant U.S. Attorney involved in the case who is listed to receive electronic notice of the court's order.

persons.name: Deputy Clerk
persons.context: A court clerk who is listed to receive notice of the docket activity and is responsible for quality control.

connections.description: T Gee is listed as an attorney of record receiving notice for the case where Ghislaine Maxwell is the appellant, indicating a legal representation relationship.
Both are listed as Assistant U.S. Attorneys receiving notice for the same case, indicating they are prosecuting colleagues.
As an Assistant U.S. Attorney, Menninger is part of the prosecution team against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.
As an Assistant U.S. Attorney, Mueller is part of the prosecution team against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Motion to Seal Granted
events.description: The Second Circuit Court of Appeals granted a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell to seal a document in her appellate case.

keyFacts: On September 28, 2020, the Second Circuit Court of Appeals granted Ghislaine Maxwell's motion to seal a document in her appellate case (20-3061).
The notice of this legal action was distributed electronically to attorneys T Gee, Laura Menninger, and Adam Mueller, as well as a deputy clerk.
The document is a routine procedural filing indicating ongoing litigation and the use of sealing motions in Ghislaine Maxwell's case.
